news_header: Early release program for non-violent prisoners in the UK.
news_text: In the UK, thousands of prisoners who have not committed sexual violence or assault are expected to be released early to alleviate overcrowding in prisons. To qualify, prisoners must have served at least 40% of their sentence and meet other conditions. Recently, 1,700 prisoners were arrested for similar reasons, with fewer than 40 unintentionally released. The current prison population is around 89,000, and the Attorney General, David Gauke, predicts an annual increase of 4,500 prisoners. Additionally, about 90% of prisoners identify as religious.
